channel.title: Help For a beginner?
channel.description: Anybody have any good tuts, or something for a person who is brand new to Photoshop. I just got it the other day and i have been fuckin' around with it. But i can't seem to figure it out.

item.title: Help For a beginner?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I have always, ALWAYS suggested people read basic grunge tutorials. Mainly because it teaches you a lot of the basics in one swoop, and usually has a nice looking end product, which boosts their confidence. Anything Basic Grunge, will teach you most of what you’ll need to know to begin using more advanced tutorials. Most people here will be assholes to you when you first begin, but don’t let that discourage you, in fact learn from it.

PhotoShop is a very useful program, and is so versatile that it doesn’t just edit photo’s it creates images from a blank canvas. It’s one of the most widely used graphics editing programs in the world. And for you to be successful in some of the major careers now, it is a basic tool you will be using.

Remember, if you get frustrated when following the tutorial, don’t just quit, go read another tutorial and use that information to help you complete the first one. Take a break, you don’t want to over do it and get burned out on your first try. That’s what happens a lot with beginners, they give up too soon.

Good Luck,
ThAt0n36Uy

EDIT:A good website I have always used for tutorials is http://www.pixel2life.com/ it has very helpful, easy to read tutorials on many subjects.

Read full topic
